{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, necroptosis is a form of programmed cell death that involves the rupture of the cell membrane and the leakage of cell contents into the extracellular space. This is in contrast to apoptosis, where the cell's remains are packaged into apoptotic bodies. Therefore, cells undergoing necroptosis do show disruption of their cell membranes. ", "answer_choice": "A"}
